segments.pli: “Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, puriso yaṃ imasmiṃ jambudīpe tiṇakaṭṭhasākhāpalāsaṃ tacchetvā ekajjhaṃ saṃhareyya;
segments.en: Suppose a person was to strip all the grass, sticks, branches, and leaves in India, gather them together into one pile,

segments.pli: Sūlaṃ karitvā ye mahāsamudde mahantakā pāṇā te mahantakesu sūlesu āvuneyya, ye mahāsamudde majjhimakā pāṇā te majjhimakesu sūlesu āvuneyya, ye mahāsamudde sukhumakā pāṇā te sukhumakesu sūlesu āvuneyya.
segments.en: Then they’d impale the large creatures in the ocean on large stakes; the medium-sized creatures on medium-sized stakes; and the small creatures on small stakes.

segments.pli: Apariyādinnā ca, bhikkhave, mahāsamudde oḷārikā pāṇā assu.
segments.en: They wouldn’t run out of sizable creatures in the ocean before

segments.pli: Atha imasmiṃ jambudīpe tiṇakaṭṭhasākhāpalāsaṃ parikkhayaṃ pariyādānaṃ gaccheyya.
segments.en: using up all the grass, sticks, branches, and leaves in India.

segments.pli: Ito bahutarā kho, bhikkhave, mahāsamudde sukhumakā pāṇā, ye na sukarā sūlesu āvunituṃ.
segments.en: There are far more small creatures in the ocean than this, so it wouldn’t be feasible to impale them on stakes.
Because of the small size of those life-forms.
That’s how big the plane of loss is.

segments.pli: Evaṃ mahantasmā kho, bhikkhave, apāyasmā parimutto diṭṭhisampanno puggalo ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti … pe … ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti.
segments.en: A person accomplished in view, exempt from that vast plane of loss, truly understands: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.

segments.pli: Tasmātiha, bhikkhave, ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yogo karaṇīyo … pe … ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yogo karaṇīyo”ti.
segments.en: That’s why you should practice meditation …”

sections.title: Suppose a person was to strip all the grass,…

suttaplex.blurb: The small creatures in the ocean are greater in number than all the foliage in the jungles of India. Still, your rebirths are more than this.
